meanings.definition: An area of open uncultivated land covered with low-growing vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The heath was a vast expanse of wild plants and bushes.
meanings.sent2: We took a walk through the heath and enjoyed the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The animals loved to play hide and seek in the heath, blending in with the greenery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a heath of ideas, each one waiting to bloom and grow.
meanings.sent5: The heath stretched out before us like a green carpet, inviting us to explore its beauty.

meanings.definition: A shrub or small tree of the heath family, typically with small evergreen leaves and small white or pink bell-shaped flowers.
meanings.sent1: The heath in our garden bloomed with delicate white flowers every spring.
meanings.sent2: She admired the heath for its resilience in harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The heath whispered secrets to the other plants, sharing stories of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a heath of emotions, each one delicate and beautiful in its own way.
meanings.sent5: The heath stood proudly among the other plants, a symbol of strength and beauty.
